Situation1: Both have several free evenings this week and can choose any for a date.
Expectation2: Contribute to community well-being through paying taxes, following public health and safety guidance, and helping in emergencies
Situation2: Tax documents are organized a month before the deadline, and a free vaccine clinic runs this weekend at the community center.
Story: I was looking forward to this week—finally, both my boyfriend and I had a few free evenings. We’d been talking about a movie night, maybe even trying that new restaurant downtown. He kept texting me ideas, and I could feel his excitement through the screen. I wanted to make it special, to show him how much I value our time together. But then, I saw the flyer for the free vaccine clinic at the community center. They needed volunteers, and I knew how important it was, especially with flu season coming up. As a citizen, I always try to do my part—paying taxes on time, following health guidelines, and helping out when I can. The clinic was only running this weekend, right when we’d planned our date. I felt torn. My boyfriend expected me to be present, to make memories with him. But my sense of responsibility to my community was just as strong. The thought of letting either side down made my stomach twist. I sat on my bed, phone in hand, wrestling with what to do next.
